title: International Trade Theory
description: Theory of comparative advantage, gains from trade, and recent developments in trade theory; examination of tariffs, quotas, exchange controls, other trade barriers and underlying policy issues; review of U.S. commercial policy, GATT, the common market, regional and world economic organizations. 4 lectures. Not open to students with credit in ECONÂ 404 or equivalent.
prerequisites: Either ECON 221 and ECON 222, or ECON 201
